chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rodney Sylaen Coleman in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Rodney Sylaen Coleman.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing. Defense provided update to the court regarding global resolution and requested new date for Plea/Sentencing along with Defendants other cases in Br.15. Court has no objection to Global offer. Case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing in branch 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.

Defendant Rodney Sylaen Coleman in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a date for plea.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.24.2022

Defendant Rodney Sylaen Coleman in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Rodney Sylaen Coleman appeared by video.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Muniz-Herrera. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Rodney Sylaen Coleman in court in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Pretrial Services Supervision Report 04.11.2022

Defendant Rodney Sylaen Coleman in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Rodney Sylaen Coleman in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rodney Sylaen Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
